sub_topic: Calculate the Gaussian curvature of a surface.
message_1: A sphere has a radius of 10 cm. Calculate its Gaussian curvature at any point on the surface of the sphere.
message_2:
The Gaussian curvature (K) of a sphere can be calculated using the formula:

K = 1/R^2

where R is the radius of the sphere.

Given that the radius (R) of the sphere is 10 cm, we can calculate the Gaussian curvature as follows:

K = 1/(10^2)
K = 1/100
K = 0.01

So, the Gaussian curvature at any point on the surface of the sphere is 0.01 cm^(-2).
